title: Self-Directed Design for Remote Sensing Image Caption Generation with Few-Sample Learning: A Mathematical Optimization Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate theoretical background (linear algebra, probability theory, optimization theory) and practical experience required. Essential understanding of matrix operations, gradient descent, and statistical evaluation metrics
context.additional_context: Aims to cultivate the ability to design efficient caption generation models in real-world industrial environments with limited labeled data, focusing on balancing mathematical modeling and computational efficiency.

learning_goals: Develop a semantic feature extractor via BYOL-based self-supervised learning and apply matrix decomposition-based dimensionality reduction techniques on a limited remote sensing image dataset (under 100 images).
Achieve over 20% improvement in caption quality by designing a teacher-student model structure using self-ensemble techniques and stochastic gradient descent (SGD) optimization.
Implement a caption generation system achieving a BLEU-4 score of 0.35 or higher on real satellite image datasets and verify statistical significance.
Document self-learning strategies using unlabeled remote sensing samples and facilitate knowledge transfer within teams, emphasizing loss function optimization and normalization techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
